newsitem.title: UK: Men seized aboard drugs ship charged in Britain.
newsitem.headline: Men seized aboard drugs ship charged in Britain.

text.p: Five men arrested in the Atlantic aboard a ship carrying more than three tonnes of cannabis resin were charged in Britain on Friday with conspiracy to illegally import drugs, police said.

The men were among a crew of eight -- six Britons, a Turk and a Frenchman -- arrested off Portugal on Monday on the Maltese-registered Simon de Danser, a 279-tonne motor vessel. The three not yet charged were still being questioned, police said.
The men were brought to Plymouth on the south-west coast of England on Thursday aboard a Royal Navy destroyer.
Customs officers said the drugs found aboard the vessel had a street value of around 13 million pounds ($21 million).

The seized ship was due to arrive on Saturday in Plymouth where it would be thoroughly searched, a Customs spokesman said. "There may be more drugs concealed on the vessel which were not obvious to the boarding party," he said.
He said the ship had been seized as part of a joint operation with British police and enforcement agencies from seven other European countries.
